result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric J. Sheehan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Eric J. Sheehan is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Eric J. Sheehan was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid in installments of $150.00 per month following payment in full of restitution set forth the the DAGPA in 22CF15.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eric J. Sheehan

records.addlTxt: 3:12 PM 22CF15, 22CM18 called.  Defendant Eric J. Sheehan in court with counsel, Attorney Nicholis J Schroeder.  Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. Court understands the def. will plea to count 1 in 22CM18 pay court costs dismiss count 2&3 and in 22CF15 Deferred Acceptance contract on count 1, plead to count 2 $443 & 10 days jail.  Atty Schroeder noted 1 error, restitution will be paid within 12 months not 6 months.  Court advises of count 1 in 22CM18 possess THC/max. penalties.  22CF15, court advises of charges in Information/max. penalties and constitutional rights.  In 22CM18 stipulate factual basis for plea.  Court finds in 22CM18 def. KVI waiving his constitutional rights and there is a factual basis for plea.  Def. pleads no contest.  Court accepts your plea and find you guilty.  Court imposes court costs in 22CM18 of $443.00.  Count 2 DC in 22CF15 def. pleads no contest.  Court accepts your plea and finds you guilty.  Court will follow term of plea agrmt. and impose court costs of $443.00 and 10 days in jail.  Total $886.  TTP $100/mo. com. 11/1?  He will be paying $100/mo. for restitution and ask it be reduced to $50/mo.  Court prefers restitution be paid first and orders $150/mo. to restitution and when that is paid, keep paying that on court costs.  Restitution to be paid within the first 12 months then court costs.  Counsel requests 60 days to report and request huber.  Report on 12/4 at 8 a.m. with huber if eligible under the rules of the PCJ and talk to them immediately.   Court reviews deferred agrmt. contract with def. in count 1 of 22CF15.  If follow the agrmt., it will be dismissed; if fail to comply with contract, State can file motion to revoke.  Subject to the Deferred Agrmt. contract, Def pleads no contest to count 1.  Court accepts your plea and defers finding of guilt for period of 2 yrs.  Mr. Seifert to sign the deferred contract and then the court will approve it.  State confirms victim rights complied with.  Court advises def. of appeal rights.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 4, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

1:46 PM 22CF15, 22CM18 Defendant Eric J. Sheehan in court with Attorney Nicholis J Schroeder  by video.   Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin.  A. State provided an offer which Mr. Sheehan will accept and ask a plea hearing on October 4th and waives his PH.  Court advises defendant of right to PH.  Defendant waives his right to PH.  Court finds Mr. Sheehan KVI waiving statutory rights for PH.  State to file and Information within 30 days of today.  The Information will mere the complaint in 22CF15.  Defendant confirms his address on file.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

02:05 PM Defendant Eric J. Sheehan in court with attorney Nicholis J Schroeder by zoom technology by video means. Prosecuting Atty Jon D. Seifert appeared for State of Wisconsin by phone means.  Court advises defendant of charges in 22CF15 and charges in 22CM18 and constitutional rights.  Court finds on advise of counsel waives time limits for PH in 22CF15.  Defendant confirms his address on file.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant
